availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John S. Buckner (Oldham County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Son of Coleman Buckner and Lucy Buckner. Married to Susan M. Buckner. Father of Curran Buckner. Resident of Oldham County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned twelve enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1850. Merchant in Oldham County in 1860. Household owned twelve enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1, p. 140B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 878.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 168B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, LaGrange, p. 55A.
"John S. Buckner (1832-1893)," Find A Grave, Memorial 83434334, accessed March 30, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/83434334.
